newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama phones to improve in two years - C&W.
newsitem.headline: Panama phones to improve in two years - C&W.

text.p: Improvements to Panama's telephone service should be seen within two years, a top official from new operator Britain's Cable and Wireless Plc said Thursday.
"I would hope that in the next year or two you will see the real progress starting to be made," Brian Smith, chairman of the board of Cable and Wireless, told Reuters.
C&W won a controlling 49 percent interest in Panama's National Telecommunications Institute (INTEL) last month with a bid of $652 million.
Smith, on a one-day visit to Panama, said "the basic fiber network for international use is there, what we've got to do is improve the access to it locally." He did not provide figures..
Smith attended a ceremony at the presidential palace where he presented President Ernesto Perez Balladares with a check for the company's controlling interest in INTEL.
Government officials expect INTEL's new operators to invest at least $500 million. Line density is expected to double and reach 25 per 100 inhabitants from 12.2 per 100 at present.
The concession also requires C&W to set up Band B cellular service within 12 months.
C&W beat out GTE Corp which offered $452 million, below the government's base price of $500 million. No other companies registered to bid in the auction.
